article.headline: Ark.-Little Rock 57, SMU 47
article.story: DALLAS -- Solomon Bozeman scored 17 points to lead three Arkansas-Little Rock players in double figures Friday as the Trojans turned a nine-point halftime deficit into a 57-47 victory over SMU, which scored just 17 points in an ice-cold second half. The Mustangs led 40-36 at the 11:03 mark of the second half after a free throw by Mike Walker. They didn't score for more than eight minutes until Rodney Clinkscales hit a 3-pointer at 3:02 to draw within 48-43. The Trojans (1-0) sealed the win at the free-throw line, hitting 9 of 10 while SMU (0-1) missed six of its final seven shots and finished the game shooting just 27 percent (13 of 48). Courtney Jackson and Eric Kibi each had 11 points for Arkansas-Little Rock. Clinkscales was the only SMU player in double figures while Papa Dia grabbed 12 rebounds to go with three blocks.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
